result.execSummary:
The defendant Pa Mee Lo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Reckless Driving-Cause Great Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(4).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
  - Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Glenn D.
  - Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
  - Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required.
Defendant did not waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 5

Defendant appeared.  Shaun W O'Connell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Phil Yang appeared.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  The defendant will need an interpreter for future court appearances.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
